notes.text:
This update fixes the following security issues:

- CVE-2015-6908: The ber_get_next function allowed remote attackers to cause a denial
  of service (reachable assertion and application crash) via crafted BER data, as
  demonstrated by an attack against slapd. (bsc#945582)
- CVE-2015-4000: Fix weak Diffie-Hellman size vulnerability. (bsc#937766)

It also fixes the following non-security bugs:

- bsc#955210: Unresponsive LDAP host lookups in IPv6 environment

This update adds the following functionality:

- fate#319300: SHA2 password hashing module that can be loaded on-demand.
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: The TLS protocol 1.2 and earlier, when a DHE_EXPORT ciphersuite is enabled on a server but not on a client, does not properly convey a DHE_EXPORT choice, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct cipher-downgrade attacks by rewriting a ClientHello with DHE replaced by DHE_EXPORT and then rewriting a ServerHello with DHE_EXPORT replaced by DHE, aka the "Logjam" issue.

notes.text: The ber_get_next function in libraries/liblber/io.c in OpenLDAP 2.4.42 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (reachable assertion and application crash) via crafted BER data, as demonstrated by an attack against slapd.
